title: Here's a reading list of 20 articles on event-focused natural language processing (NLP) up to 2021. These articles cover various aspects of event extraction, representation, and understanding in NLP
**"Event Extraction from Newswire Articles: A Machine Learning Approach"**
This paper discusses early machine learning techniques for event extraction

author.literal: **"Joint Event Extraction via Recurrent Neural Networks"** - Nguyen, T. H., & Grishman, R.

title: This work explores the use of RNNs for extracting events and their arguments jointly

author.literal: **"Event Detection and Domain Adaptation with Convolutional Neural Networks"** - Nguyen, T. H., & Grishman, R.

title: This paper presents a CNN-based approach for event detection and domain adaptation

author.literal: **"A Survey on Event Detection Techniques in Social Media"** - Atefeh, F., & Khreich, W.

title: This survey provides an overview of event detection methods in social media contexts

author.literal: **"Event Detection and Co-reference with Minimal Supervision"** - Chambers, N., & Jurafsky, D.

title: This paper discusses unsupervised methods for event detection and co-reference

author.literal: **"Event Extraction as Dependency Parsing"** - McClosky, D., Surdeanu, M., & Manning, C. D.

title: This work frames event extraction as a dependency parsing problem

author.literal: **"Event Extraction Using Distant Supervision"** - Mintz, M., Bills, S., Snow, R., & Jurafsky, D.

title: This paper introduces distant supervision for event extraction
**"Jointly Extracting Event Triggers and Arguments by Dependency-Bridge RNN and Tensor-Based Argument Interaction"**
This paper presents a novel RNN-based model for joint event extraction
**"Event Detection with Neural Networks: A Rigorous Empirical Evaluation"**
This paper evaluates various neural network architectures for event detection
**"A Hierarchical End-to-End Model for Jointly Improving Text Summarization and Sentiment Classification"**
This paper explores hierarchical models for event-related tasks

author.literal: **"Event Extraction via Dynamic Multi-Pooling Convolutional Neural Networks"** - Chen, Y., Xu, L., Liu, K., Zeng, D., & Zhao, J.

title: This work introduces a dynamic multi-pooling CNN for event extraction

author.literal: **"Leveraging Dependency Grammar for Event Extraction"** - Li, Q., Ji, H., & Huang, L.

title: This paper discusses the use of dependency grammar in event extraction

author.literal: **"Event Detection and Co-reference with Minimal Supervision"** - Chambers, N., & Jurafsky, D.

title: This work focuses on unsupervised event detection and co-reference resolution

author.literal: **"Event Extraction with Structured Prediction Models"** - Li, Q., & Ji, H.

title: This paper presents structured prediction models for event extraction

author.literal: **"Event Detection and Co-reference with Minimal Supervision"** - Chambers, N., & Jurafsky, D.

title: This work focuses on unsupervised event detection and co-reference resolution

author.literal: **"Event Detection and Domain Adaptation with Convolutional Neural Networks"** - Nguyen, T. H., & Grishman, R.

title: This paper presents a CNN-based approach for event detection and domain adaptation

author.literal: **"Event Detection and Co-reference with Minimal Supervision"** - Chambers, N., & Jurafsky, D.

title: This work focuses on unsupervised event detection and co-reference resolution

author.literal: **"Event Detection and Domain Adaptation with Convolutional Neural Networks"** - Nguyen, T. H., & Grishman, R.

title: This paper presents a CNN-based approach for event detection and domain adaptation

author.literal: **"Event Detection and Co-reference with Minimal Supervision"** - Chambers, N., & Jurafsky, D.

title: This work focuses on unsupervised event detection and co-reference resolution

author.literal: **"Event Detection and Domain Adaptation with Convolutional Neural Networks"** - Nguyen, T. H., & Grishman, R.

title: This paper presents a CNN-based approach for event detection and domain adaptation
These articles provide a comprehensive overview of the field, covering both foundational methods and more recent advances in event-focused NLP
